subject: low level junit messing: "Class not found"
msgSnippet: Hi I just try to do some first steps with junit. Despite of all the tutorials, blogposts, etc. it seems impossible to me. Here s what I want to do: 1. writing
messageBody:
Hi
I just try to do some first steps with junit. Despite of all the
tutorials, blogposts, etc. it seems impossible to me.

Here's what I want to do:
1. writing a simple test
2. compiling the test
3. running the test in the commandline

Here's what I did:
system:
- junit.jar lives in /opt/java/libraries

Env. vars:
- .bash_profile:
-- $CLASSPATH:/opt/java/libraries/junit.jar
-- $JLIBS:/opt/java/libraries

$ cat SimpleTest.java
import junit.framework.TestCase;
public class SimpleTest extends TestCase {
public void testTry() {
fail("Not yet implemented.");
}
}

$ javac -classpath $JLIBS/junit.jar SimpleTest.java

$ java -classpath $JLIBS/junit.jar junit.textui.TestRunner SimpleTest

the same with:

$ java -classpath $JLIBS/junit.jar junit.textui.TestRunner
SimpleTest.testTry
Class not found "SimpleTest.testTry"


Class not found "SimpleTest"

I just can't solved that error. I think I'm going crazy.

Can somebody help me?

Thanks
Ben
